tweet.content:

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Plus, constantly finger-pointing at the "evil SJWs" is too Miloan/Cernovichish for my liking. I want no association with those types

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Slapping adversarial labels on ppl is not a healthy practice. It's tempting, it's a great shortcut, but objectively speaking it isn't good

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: For the record: I don't like the "SJW" moniker and use it only to conserve characters. Limited medium and all

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: ...for their "wicked ways". Just as is common for new socjus adepts to alienate friends with the "problematic!!!" preachiness

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: The metaphor goes deep. It was common for new Christians, as is for new "SJWs", to constantly find opportunity to rebuke old friends...

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Considering my upbringing re:Christianity, my rejecting the moral self-righteousness of the social justice types was literally inevitable

tweet.author: MrNobre

tweet.author: MrNobre

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
To fail English you have to basically be a complete moron
Failing Portuguese is a common occurrence

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: My point is: life in Brazil is so fucking shitty even our language gives us a hard time.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Syntax, grammar, verb conjugation, hell, even your dictionary is easier. You guys have 170k words. We have 435k.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Anyway, my point is English is super easy and I'm not sure why English speakers perpetuate the lie that it isn't.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: ...inanimate objects with no cultural frame of reference for you to grasp at

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Try wrapping your head around the idea that we have a bunch of arbitrary genders for...

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
In Portuguese, a table is a she. A car is a he. A snake is a she. A plane is a he. A bike is a she.
There's really no rhyme or reason to it

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Gendered nouns. Gendered fucking nouns. Do you know how EASY it is to just call everything an IT and be done with it?

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: (I meant verb CONJUGATION, not pronunciation)

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
That's right. You guys have 4 words to indicate "run"
We have 40.
Fucking FORTY.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
Here's how the verb "to run" is conjugated in Portuguese
https://t.co/b4HCQvxL1a

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
Quick example: verb pronunciation. It's grade school-easy.
English: RUN/RAN/RUNS/RUNNING.
Done.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
English spelling/pronunciation is arbitrary as fuck and makes no sense, I will give you that
But the structure of the language is dead easy

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
First of all, anyone who follows me knows I'm fucking dumb
Second: English is a RIDICULOUSLY easy language

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
Dumbest thing I kept hearing when I 1st immigrated: "u must be super smart, English is very hard to learn"
You're wrong on both counts fam

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: As a Brazilian I knew of no prior history of particular closeness between our Colombians neighbors. This is very touching, and unexpected

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
This is how many Colombians turned out to pay their respects to the fallen Brazilian soccer players
https://t.co/uWKWOgWUoD

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
The surviving members of Chapecoense at the vigil
https://t.co/jcNx6AC3g4

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: @bealangi normally I'd say it might disrespect some but I think everyone, or most everyone anyway, understood the message

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: @bealangi respect. They dubbed it "90 minutes of silence".

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: It's fair to say that the ONLY sense of patriotism many Brazilians feel is because of soccer -- for better or for worse

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: To say Brazilians really like their soccer is a MASSIVE understatement. It's completely woven into our sense of self

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: One thing to keep in mind is that soccer isn't just a sport to Brazilians. It's intrinsically tied in with national identity and pride

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: It looks like Chapecoense will be this generation's Mamonas/Senna.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Senna (racecar driver) and Mamonas Assassinas' deaths were the two biggest watershed moments in recent Brazilian history I'd say

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: THAT was our "Beatles breaking up moment", except infinitely sadder.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
They exploded onto the music scene in 1995, becoming massively popular with kids 15-20.
The band died the following year on a plane crash

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Mamonas Assassinas was a "novelty" rock band. Their songs were all your typical jokey stuff, but they were pretty musically talented

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
The last time Brazil was this heartbroken over a group of people dying at a plane crash was in 1996.
Mamonas Assassinas.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Yep. World Cup 1994. Drug dealers had money on that match, if I remember it correctly. https://t.co/sB54fPpWxg

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: @nickmon1112 thanks man.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Fox Sports Brazil aired 90 minutes of just a black screen on the slot that would've played the matched. Unprecedented.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: And they were on their way to the finals. The game would've been yesterday. Fans are inconsolable.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: This is truly sad. Chapecoense had never made into Major League soccer before. This was their first year

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content: Mind you, if I remember it correctly, they are cheering for the team they would be playing against, had they not died.

tweet.author: MrNobre
tweet.content:
Colombian fans cheering Chapecoense, the Brazilian soccer team who perished at an air crash earlier this week
https://t.co/MoP1VxljvI
